column7: ANZ's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 60,620 tCO2e.

column6: GHG emissions intensity
column13: In 2023, ANZ was invited to participate in a solar farm project on a rural site in eastern Australia. ANZ undertook initial due diligence and determined the project would require an EP DD to fully examine the potential environmental and social risks associated with the project.
column20: Solar farm, due diligence, environmental risk, social risk

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column13: In 2023, ANZ provided Project Finance for developing an EV battery manufacturing plant in Europe. In conducting its initial due diligence on the project, including its Environmental Impact Assessment, ANZ categorised the project as a C under the Equator Principles, meaning it had low environmental and social risk.
column20: Project Finance, EV battery, Environmental Impact Assessment

column6: Emissions of ozone-depleting substances (ODS)
column13: In 2023, ANZ developed a program to install solar in selected leased retail branches. ANZ executed Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) with Upstream Energy, which installed and will maintain the solar arrays with no direct up-front cost to ANZ or its landlords. ANZ purchased the renewable electricity from the solar array for the lease term. At the same time, landlords execute a 10-year roof licence agreement, after which the solar array ownership is transferred to the landlord.
column20: Power Purchase Agreement, Upstream Energy, renewable electricity

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions

column6: Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: ANZ aligns its waste-to-landfill reduction target with the announcement of a ban on single-use plastics in Victoria by developing a Reusable Container Program in partnership with ReturnR at its head office in Docklands, Australia, in June 2022. ANZ engaged its retailers, cleaners, facility managers, and staff to provide them with reusable products (coffee cups and food containers) at the point of sale.
column20: Reusable Container Program, waste-to-landfill reduction target, ReturnR

column6: Waste generated

column7: ANZ directed 808 tonnes of waste to a landfill.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: ANZ's Supplier Code of Practice (SCOP) outlines its minimum requirements for suppliers, including human rights and workplace relations, occupational health and safety, ethical business practices, information management and confidentiality, accessibility, environmental management, and supplier diversity.
column20: Supplier Code of Practice, supplier, environmental management

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Under the credit policy, ANZ reviews its large business customers at least annually. It includes considering issues specified in ANZ's Social and Environmental Risk Policy and, where relevant, sensitive sector Requirements. ANZ expects its customers in all sectors to implement appropriate stakeholder engagement strategies and plans, and ANZ has included this consideration in the Social and Environmental Risk screening tool.\t
column20: Credit policy, Social and Environmental Risk Policy, sensitive sector

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column8: First Nations Recruitment, Retention and Professional Development strategy
column13: ANZ developed and implemented ANZ's First Nations Recruitment, Retention and Professional Development Strategy (2024-2026) to drive greater representation across all levels of the organisation and empower First Nations employees to build meaningful careers at ANZ.
column20: First Nations Recruitment, Retention and Professional Development strategy, First Nations, career

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: ANZ's bi-annual Group-wide engagement survey, My Voice, continues to be one of the primary ways it receives feedback from its people and understands their experience of working at ANZ. ANZ's results continue to exceed the global Finance & Insurance (F&I) benchmark on all items Ã¢ÂÂ and, in some cases, exceed the Global Best in Class (GBIC) benchmark (top 10% of organisations globally).

column6: Parental leave
column13: ANZ's Volunteer Leave Policy applies to permanent, regular, and fixed-term employees, providing at least one day of paid volunteer leave each year. In 2023, ANZ's people volunteered 75,812.5 hours to community organisations. It represents more than 9,477 working days and $3,048,733 in value to the community.
column20: Volunteer Leave Policy, paid volunteer leave, community organisation

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column7: Although this topic was not determined to be material through its annual stakeholder engagement process, ANZ does consult with employees and the Finance Sector Union in Australia on major operational changes.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: ANZ continues to focus on providing programs to support the well-being of its people across all domains, including physical, mental, social and financial well-being. ANZ's regular well-being webinars have strong engagement, with nearly 4,450 employees attending yearly.
column20: Well-being seminar, financial well-being, social well-being

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: ANZ improved its workplace adjustments process for new and existing employees, including Personal Emergency Evacuation Plans (PEEP) as part of onboarding or cross-boarding to enhance workplace safety for all employees.

column6: Occupational health services

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: ANZ's Green Ambassador program, launched in 2018, empowers its people to live sustainably by providing education and pathways to act. Over August, ANZ hosted the third Green Ambassador Summit, focusing on the intersection between creating a sustainable and cost-efficient lifestyle. Employees were invited to consider their consumption habits and how to create a more energy-efficient home.
column20: Green Ambassador Program, Green Ambassador Summit, energy-efficient home

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: In Australia, ANZ implemented Mental Health First Aid training, with more than 170 employees now accredited to support colleagues experiencing mental health issues. ANZ also introduced suicide and self-harm guidelines in India in addition to those already used in Australia, New Zealand and Manila.
column20: Mental Health First Aid training, mental health issue, self-harm guideline

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: This year saw the expansion of ANZ's Return to Work program, which supports individuals who have been out of the workforce for two or more years back into meaningful employment. With opportunities across Technology, Commercial, Institutional and Retail, more than 40 new employees were hired across Australia and India.
column20: Return to Work program, employment, workforce

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Customer aggression continues to be one of the key risks to employee well-being. In recognition, a refreshed capability framework was developed and revised inappropriate customer behaviour training is being developed. Both initiatives aim to support ANZ's frontline employees in safely de-escalating instances of customer aggression.
column20: Customer behaviour training, customer aggression, employee well-being

column13: ANZ's Australian Digital Team launched the Deque Axe tool for software engineers to create accessible digital experiences. The tool integrates into engineer workflows and monitors ANZ web pages for compliance with industry accessibility standards.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: ANZ continues to provide enhanced training to Australian employees through leader-led meetings and workshops to identify and support customers needing extra care. Topics include family violence, elder financial abuse, Powers of Attorney, gambling harm, supporting customers with disability and those experiencing grief.
column20: Enhanced training, workshop, customer, extra care

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: ANZ's Engineering Career Pathways program, launched this year, is designed to help attract, grow and retain these critical skill sets. The pathways comprise eight specialisations and seven craft levels, providing career progression to people focused on mastering the craft of engineering.
column20: Engineering Career Pathways, critical skill, engineering
